title: K-12 Practice-Centered Problem-Solving Intensive Programming Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Computer Literacy and Logical Reasoning Experience
context.additional_context: Small-group settings enabling personalized feedback, emphasizing practice-based on real-world cases

learning_goals: Learners analyze 3 real-life problems (e.g., vending machine change calculation, simple game logic) and convert them into pseudocode containing conditional statements and loops. Each pseudocode must achieve 3+ points (out of 5) in the teacher/peer evaluation rubric (clarity, logic, completeness).
Implement and debug simple algorithms using the Python programming language.

In a 4-member team-based project, learners analyze a given scientific problem (e.g., environmental pollution solutions), document the logical problem-solving process in 3 stages (problem definition → hypothesis setting → experimental design), create a 5-minute presentation, and achieve an 'Excellent' rating in at least 2 out of 3 peer evaluation rubric items (clarity, logic, creativity).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
